snippet: The Republican presidential hopefuls with backgrounds in ordering layoffs and lobbying Congress can’t relate to struggling voters.
abstract: Editorial criticizes field of Republican presidential candidates, saying they are out of touch with struggles of average Americans, and have offered nothing but tired or extremist economic prescriptions; contends that Mitt Romney is particularly ill-suited to empathize with low- and middle-income Americans given his history as a high-flying liquidator for Wall Street firm Bain Capital.
lead_paragraph: The Republican presidential hopefuls with backgrounds in ordering layoffs and lobbying Congress can’t relate to struggling voters.
